nested.name: jsx3.$Array
nested.text: Useful extensions to the JavaScript Array class.

nested.name: jsx3.$AsyncCB
nested.text: The callback object passed as the single argument to an asynchronous method.

nested.name: jsx3.$AsyncRV
nested.text: The return value from an asynchronous method.

nested.name: jsx3.$Function
nested.text: Useful extensions to the JavaScript Function class.

nested.name: jsx3.$Hash
nested.text: Useful extensions to the JavaScript Object class for emulating a hashtable.

nested.name: jsx3.$Object
nested.text: Useful extensions to the JavaScript Object class.

nested.name: jsx3.$String
nested.text: Useful extensions to the JavaScript String class.

nested.name: jsx3.BlockX
nested.deprecated: Renamed to jsx3.gui.BlockX. Most functionality of this class was moved into a new interface, jsx3.xml.Cacheable.

nested.name: jsx3.Boolean
nested.text: Boolean class encapsulates GI's XML boolean values (0 and 1 rather than true and false).

nested.name: jsx3.EVT
nested.text: This class is the static event controller for the GI framework.

field.name: ABSOLUTEPATH
field.text: Absolute path (the path on the server (file or http) from the accessible root to the directory containing the JSX system folder. Specifies a directory (ie it's empty or ends with a "/").

field.name: APPPATH
field.text: Path for application resources (the prefix that precedes JSXAPPS). Specifies a directory (ie it's empty or ends with a "/").

field.name: CACHE
field.text: The jsx3.app.Cache instance used by the JSX system to store XML and XSL documents.

field.name: DESERIALIZE
field.deprecated: The new jsx3.lang.Class framework does not use this constant for instantiating objects.

field.name: EVENT
field.text: wrapped static access to the current JavaScript event
field.deprecated: Static access to the event object is deprecated as it is not cross-platform. Access to the current event object, where available, is granted via a method parameter or model event context variable.

field.name: INITIALIZE
field.deprecated: The new jsx3.lang.Class framework does not use this constant for instantiating objects.

method.name: $A
method.text: Injects class jsx3.$Array into array instance a.

method.name: $F
method.text: Injects class jsx3.$Function into function instance f.

method.name: $H
method.text: Injects class jsx3.$Hash into object instance o. If o is an array, it is first converted into an object by setting a property equal to 1 for each item in the array.

method.name: $O
method.text: Injects class jsx3.$Object into object instance o.

method.name: $S
method.text: Injects class jsx3.$String into string instance s.

method.name: $Y

param.name: f
param.text: the function to wrap.

method.text:
Wraps an asynchronous method. An asynchronous method follows a very strict contract. It can be called with any number of parameters but the wrapped method sees only a single parameter, an instance of jsx3.$AsyncCB. The wrapped method must call done() on this method parameter, either synchronously or asynchronously. The done() method takes a single parameter, which is the return value of the method.
The wrapped method should not itself return anything. The only exception to this is that the method may return and instance of jsx3.$AsyncRV. In this case, the method will return when and with the same return value as the returned instance of jsx3.$AsyncRV.
Client code that calls the asynchronous method will see a synchronous return value of type jsx3.$AsyncRV. Client code should use the when() method of this return value to continue execution when the asynchronous method has completed. Or this return value may be used in conjuction with other asynchronous methods (such as by passing is as a parameter to an asynchronous method).
Another feature of asynchronous methods is that you can pass instances of jsx3.$AsyncRV as parameters to the method and the method is only invoked once all of those parameters have returned. The parameters that the wrapped method sees are automatically converted into the return values of the jsx3.$AsyncRV instances.

method.name: $Z

param.name: strMethod
param.text: the function to wrap or the name of a method of objThis to wrap.

param.name: objThis
param.text: optionally, the object to which to bind the wrapper.

method.text:
Returns an asynchronous wrapper of a synchronous method. The returned method is method strMethod bound to object objThis. objThis is optional and may be an object or an instance of jsx3.$AsyncRV. If the latter, then the wrapped method is only called on the return value of objThis after objThis returns.
The wrapper takes the same parameters as the wrapped method. However, instead of returning the return value of the wrapped method, it returns an instance of jsx3.$AsyncRV.
The returned method may be passed parameters that are actually instances of jsx3.$AsyncRV. In this case, the wrapped method is only actually called when all the parameters have returned.

method.name: GO

param.name: strIdName
param.text: JSX 'id' or 'name' property for the object to get a handle to

param.name: strNS
param.text: namespace for the server to get the object from; when a 'name' is passed as @strNameId (as opposed to the object's 'id'), this allows the global JSX controller to more-quickly find the server that owns the given object. As this parameter is optional, the JSX controller will try to locate the named object by iterating through all server instances running in the browser in load order if no namespace is passed. When an 'id' is passed, the namespaces is not required as it explicitly contains this namespace.

return.text: handle to given JSX GUI object or null if none found

method.text: global call to get a handle to a specific JSX GUI Object; NOTE: This is a significant modification used to support multi-instance servers. It is equivalently the same as calling 'getJO' in all builds prior to 3.0; returns null if object cannot be found. The specific app (a jsx3.app.Server instance) can also be queried for objects using its own DOM APIs.

method.name: doDefine

param.name: strClassName
param.text: named class containing the anonymous function to call

param.name: anonymousFunction
param.text: inner function containing named prototypes to bind

method.text: Registers all prototype functions and properties, contained by the inner function @anonymousFunction; used by jsx3.Object

method.name: doImplement

param.name: subClass
param.text: named subclass to transfer prototypes to

param.name: superClass
param.text: named superclass to transfer prototypes from

return.text: the eval value of the script

method.text: transfers prototype methods from one class to another

method.name: doInherit

param.name: subClass
param.text: named subclass to transfer prototypes to

param.name: superClass
param.text: named superclass to transfer prototypes from

param.name: bImplement
param.text: if true, @superClass is an interface

return.text: the eval value of the script

method.text: transfers prototype methods from one class to another; establishes @superClass as the super for @subClass

method.name: doMixin

param.name: objInstance
param.text: any JavaScript object

param.name: strClassName
param.text: the name of a class

method.text: transfer the methods of a class to a object instance

method.name: eval

param.name: strScript
param.text: the JavaScript to evaluate.

param.name: objContext
param.text: a map containing the local variable context. Each key is the name of a variable to expose and each value is the value of that variable.

method.text: Evaluates a JavaScript expression in a controlled local variable context. Every name-value pair in objContext will be exposed as a local variable to the evaluated script. All names must be valid JavaScript names in order to be exposed as local variables. Any invalid names will be ignored.

method.name: getClassConstants

param.name: strClassName
param.text: name of the class to get the constants for. For example: jsx3.gui.Block, jsx3.gui.Select, etc.

method.text: Returns a JavaScript array of all named constants for this class; these names (strings) can then be used by the developer to lookup/evaluate/modify applicable constants; To derive the value for the first named constant for the jsx3.gui.Block class, a method such as the following would work: var myFirstConstantValue = eval(jsx3.getClassConstants("jsx3.gui.Block")[0]); NOTE: passing an invalid class name results in a null value being returned. If no constants exist for the given class, an empty array will be returned

method.name: getClassMethods

param.name: strClassName
param.text: name of the class to get the constants for. For example: jsx3.gui.Block, jsx3.gui.Select, etc.

method.text: Returns a new-line-delimited (e.g., \n) list of all instance methods for the particular class

method.name: getEnv

param.name: strKey
param.text: the case-insensitive environment variable key.

method.text: Returns the value of a system-wide environment variable. System-wide environment parameters are set either by query parameters in the launch page URL or by attributes on the GI script tag. System-wide environment variable keys always begin with "jsx" and do not begin with "jsxapp".

method.name: getInstanceMethods

param.name: strClassName
param.text: name of the class to get the constants for. For example: jsx3.gui.Block, jsx3.gui.Select, etc.

method.text: Returns a new-line-delimited (e.g., \n) list of all instance methods for the particular class

method.name: getSharedCache
method.text: Returns the global JSX XML/XSL cache. This cache is shared by all applications in the JSX runtime. Every server cache instance consults this cache when getDocument() is called on the server cache with a cache id that does not correspond to a document in the server cache.

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Returns the version of General Interface.

method.name: log

param.name: strMessage
param.text: the message to send to the logging system.

method.text:
Sends a message to the logging system. This method is an alias for jsx3.util.Logger.GLOBAL.info().
Since this method is defined before the logging system, any messages passed to this method before the logging system is defined are cached and sent with the first message passed after the logging system is defined.

method.name: out

param.name: strErrorNumber
param.text: arbitrary identifier passed by the calling function to track the specific location of the error

param.name: strMessage
param.text: message to describe the error

param.name: PRIORITY
param.text: one of 1, 2 or 3, with 1 being most serious (red..orange..yellow)

param.name: bTrace
param.text: true if null; if true, the stack trace is printed, displaying the order of the call stack

method.text: Alias for jsx3.util.Logger.doLog() (formerly jsx3.Error.doLog()).

method.name: require

param.name: strClass
param.text: the fully-qualified names of the classes to load.

method.text: Ensures that one or more classes is available before this method returns. Any class that fails to load will throw an error. Only classes that can be found by the system class loader may be loaded in this manner.

method.name: requireAsync

param.name: strClass
param.text: the fully-qualified names of the classes to load.

throws.text: if the package of strClass is not registered as a system, add-in or application classpath.

method.text:
Loads a class or classes asynchronously. If multiple classes are specified they are loaded serially rather than in parallel. This method does not resolve dependencies, i.e. if the class to load contains a call to jsx3.require that class will be loaded synchronously.
Note that if strClass does not correspond to an file on the classpath or if the corresponding file does not actualy define a class whose name is strClass, this async function will never complete and no callbacks will be executed.

method.name: resolveURI

param.name: strURI
param.text: the URI to resolve.

method.text: Returns a URI resolved against the default URI resolver, URIResolver.DEFAULT.

method.name: sleep

param.name: objFunction
param.text: an anonymous function to call after a timeout.

param.name: strId
param.text: the id of this job. If this parameter is not null and a job already exists in the queue with this id, then this job is not added to the queue.

param.name: objThis
param.text: if provided, this object is the "this" context for the anonymous function objFunction when it is called.

param.name: bClobber
param.text: if true and a job already exists, this new job clobbers the old job.

method.text: A replacement for peppering code with window.setTimeout(fnct, 0) statements. This method places all jobs in a queue. Each job gets its own stack.
